video.title: Unreal Engine & C++ Tutorial - Endless Runner Game 🏃🏽‍♀️
video.description:
Learn how to use Unreal Engine and C++ to create an endless runner game.
🏃🏻🏃🏼🏃🏽🏃🏾🏃🏿🏃‍♂️🏃‍♀️

✏️ Course created by Fahir from Awesome Tuts. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5c-DuzPdH9iaWYdI0v0uzw
🔗 More tutorials from Fahir: https://awesometuts.com/

⭐️ Project Assets ⭐️
(This is a multi-part rar archive. You must download all these parts before you can unarchive.)
🔗 Part 1: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/0uocCeETVSFhkMnwqb6w
🔗 Part 2: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/v5BdT6YYSzaGMUI2EJLb
🔗 Part 3: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/fbq4wOpQb688WYXA8OxA
🔗 Part 4: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/eXhT4kYoShq8gIi6c1Hu
🔗 Part 5: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/qPUf6bezRAi3NJFP53H6

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Game Preview
⌨️ (0:01:26) Creating The Player Class
⌨️ (0:29:47) Creating Obstacles
⌨️ (0:37:05) Creating The Level
⌨️ (0:56:06) Spawning Levels
⌨️ (1:18:36) Destroying The Player And Restarting The Level

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: MrChipoclas
topLevelComment.text: Amazing tutorial, I was looking for a project to get a refresher on C++ and not just blueprints which is what I normally use, thank you very much.

topLevelComment.text: Differences to make it in UE5?

topLevelComment.author: Noob4Head
topLevelComment.text:
Awesome Awesome video tutorial.
Everything is very very clear and easy to follow.
I'm using this a a template for my first game I want to create as a school project and I having a blast following along.
thanks a million for this amazing video

topLevelComment.author: Kamil Kaniewski
topLevelComment.text:
The real question is: did he get the SSD drive in the end? :D
joking...

Nice tutorial - i have learned some things doing it :).

There is one thing though - since it is merged from few videos i think there is one part missing (creating spikes) around 1:18:00.
Was real surprise when i got to the point: "This class will inherit from 'Spikes' class"... wait a moment... I DO NOT have 'Spikes'!.... :D

Tried looking for the missing part at Awesome Tuts channel but there this video ends even sooner.

@edit:
nevermind - for some reason i missed the part with creating obstacles/spikes :D here: 29:45... and was able to fill in the objects on my own during levels creation.
How did this happen? ... probably made a break -> got to a "checkpoint" and skipped one on the way :D
Well... i am dumb it seems but i am not afraid to admit it! :P
